Sure, here are some tips to identify different bird species while birdwatching in Stony Brook:

1. Observe their behavior: Birds have different behaviors depending on their species. For example, certain birds will dive into the water for fish, some will hop along the ground, and others will cling to tree trunks. Observing their behavior can give you clues to their identity.

2. Listen to their calls: Birds make a variety of sounds such as songs, calls, and chatters. Listening to their calls can help you identify the species even if you can't see them.

3. Check their physical features: Different bird species have distinct physical features such as beak shape, wing color, and tail length. Paying attention to these features can help you identify the type of bird you are looking at.

4. Bring a field guide: A field guide is an essential tool for birdwatchers. It includes illustrations and descriptions of different bird species, helping you to identify them on-the-spot.

5. Join a birdwatching group: Joining a birdwatching group is another great way to learn about different bird species. Experienced birdwatchers can teach you their tips and tricks for identifying birds and take you to the best birdwatching spots in Stony Brook.
